title: Get Started
text: package extension, new admiral best place first start reading Get Started page. extension package follows main idea conventions, re-uses many functions admiral, important thoroughly understand able use admiralneuro.

title: Get Started
text: neuroscience ADaM data structures, overview flow example function calls common steps provided following vignette: Creating ADAPET/ADTPET admiralneuro also provides template R scripts starting point. can created calling use_ad_template() admiral, e.g., list available templates can obtained list_all_templates() admiral:
code: library(admiral)  use_ad_template(   adam_name = "adapet",   save_path = "./ad_adapet.R",   package = "admiralneuro" ) admiral::list_all_templates(package = "admiralneuro") #> Existing ADaM templates in package 'admiralneuro': #> • ADAPET #> • ADTPET

title: Get Started
text: Support provided via admiral Slack channel. Additionally, please feel free raise issues GitHub repository.

title: Creating ADTPET and ADAPET
text: article describes creation PET Scan ADaMs. recommend splitting amyloid tau two distinct ADaM datasets. vignette presents combined approach initial setup, parameter mapping finals steps. splits separate sections data type, require different processes: starting ADTPET (Tau PET Scan Analysis Dataset), followed ADAPET (Amyloid PET Scan Analysis Dataset). advise first consult admiral Creating BDS Finding ADaM vignette. programming workflow around creating general set-BDS ADaM dataset using admiral functions . vignette, focus neuro-specific steps avoid repeating information maintaining content two places. , code vignette completely executable; recommend consulting ADTPET ADAPET template scripts view full workflow. Note: examples assume CDISC SDTM /ADaM format input unless otherwise specified.

previous_headings: Introduction
title: Creating ADTPET and ADAPET
text: examples vignette require following packages.
code: library(admiral) library(admiralneuro) library(pharmaversesdtm) library(dplyr) library(lubridate) library(stringr) library(metatools)

title: Creating ADTPET and ADAPET
text: Read Data Initial PET Scan Analysis Dataset Set-Assign PARAMCD, PARAM, PARAMN Map AVAL AVALC variables ADTPET (Tau PET Scan Analysis Dataset) Convert amyloid SUVR Centiloid Derive Criterion Flag Variables Amyloid Categories Remaining PET Scan Analysis Dataset Set-

previous_headings: Programming Workflow
title: Creating ADTPET and ADAPET
text: start, data frames needed creation ADTPET ADAPET loaded global environment. Reading data usually company specific process, however, purpose vignette, use example data admiralneuro. utilize NV, SUPPNV, AG ADSL basis PET Scan ADaM datasets. loading input data, can combine NV domain SUPPNV supplementary domain easier use next steps. Using metatools::combine_supp() function avoids need manually transpose merge supplementary dataset corresponding domain.
code: nv <- admiralneuro::nv_neuro %>%   convert_blanks_to_na()  suppnv <- admiralneuro::suppnv_neuro %>%   convert_blanks_to_na()  ag <- admiralneuro::ag_neuro %>%   convert_blanks_to_na()  adsl <- admiralneuro::adsl_neuro %>%   convert_blanks_to_na() nv_suppnv <- combine_supp(nv, suppnv)

previous_headings: Programming Workflow
what: Initial PET Scan Analysis Dataset Set-up
title: Creating ADTPET and ADAPET
text: following steps used merge ADSL variables source data NV (previously combined SUPPNV), along tracer information AG dataset, without distinguishing Tau Amyloid data stage. distinction made later. Common analysis variables Analysis Date (ADT) Relative Analysis Day (ADY) can also derived process. Note sections relevant vignette included steps . get detailed guidance steps, refer admiral Creating BDS Finding ADaM vignette.
code: adsl_vars <- exprs(TRTSDT, TRTEDT, TRT01A, TRT01P)  adpet <- nv_suppnv %>%   derive_vars_merged(     dataset_add = adsl,     new_vars = adsl_vars,     by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID)   ) %>%   derive_vars_merged(     dataset_add = ag,     new_vars = exprs(AGTRT, AGCAT),     by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID, VISIT, NVLNKID = AGLNKID)   ) %>%   derive_vars_dt(     new_vars_prefix = "A",     dtc = NVDTC   ) %>%   derive_vars_dy(reference_date = TRTSDT, source_vars = exprs(ADT))

previous_headings: Programming Workflow > Initial PET Scan Analysis Dataset Set-up
what: Create PARAMCD, PARAM, and PARAMN variables
title: Creating ADTPET and ADAPET
text: next step create assign parameter level variables PARAMCD, PARAM, PARAMN. , lookup can created based SDTM --TESTCD, --CAT, --LOC, --METHOD REFREG values join source data. lookup may now joined data parameters look like:
code: param_lookup <- tibble::tribble(   ~NVTESTCD, ~NVCAT, ~NVLOC, ~REFREG, ~NVMETHOD, ~PARAMCD, ~PARAM, ~PARAMN,   "SUVR", "FBP", "NEOCORTICAL COMPOSITE", "Whole Cerebellum", "AVID FBP SUVR PIPELINE", "SUVRAFBP", "AVID FBP Standard Uptake Ratio Neocortical Composite Whole Cerebellum", 1,   "SUVR", "FBB", "NEOCORTICAL COMPOSITE", "Whole Cerebellum", "AVID FBB SUVR PIPELINE", "SUVRAFBB", "AVID FBB Standard Uptake Ratio Neocortical Composite Whole Cerebellum", 2,   "SUVR", "FBP", "NEOCORTICAL COMPOSITE", "Whole Cerebellum", "BERKELEY FBP SUVR PIPELINE", "SUVRBFBP", "BERKELEY FBP Standard Uptake Ratio Neocortical Composite Whole Cerebellum", 3,   "SUVR", "FBB", "NEOCORTICAL COMPOSITE", "Whole Cerebellum", "BERKELEY FBB SUVR PIPELINE", "SUVRBFBB", "BERKELEY FBB Standard Uptake Ratio Neocortical Composite Whole Cerebellum", 4,   "SUVR", "FTP", "NEOCORTICAL COMPOSITE", "Inferior Cerebellar Gray Matter", "AVID FTP SUVR PIPELINE", "SUVRAFTP", "AVID FTP Standard Uptake Ratio Neocortical Composite Inferior Cerebellar Gray Matter", 5,   "SUVR", "FTP", "NEOCORTICAL COMPOSITE", "Inferior Cerebellar Gray Matter", "BERKELEY FTP SUVR PIPELINE", "SUVRBFTP", "BERKELEY FTP Standard Uptake Ratio Neocortical Composite Inferior Cerebellar Gray Matter", 6,   "VR", "FBP", NA, NA, "FBP VISUAL CLASSIFICATION", "VRFBP", "FBP Qualitative Visual Classification", 7,   "VR", "FBB", NA, NA, "FBB VISUAL CLASSIFICATION", "VRFBB", "FBB Qualitative Visual Classification", 8,   "VR", "FTP", NA, NA, "FTP VISUAL CLASSIFICATION", "VRFTP", "FTP Qualitative Visual Classification", 9 ) adpet <- adpet %>%   derive_vars_merged_lookup(     dataset_add = param_lookup,     new_vars = exprs(PARAMCD, PARAM, PARAMN),     by_vars = exprs(NVTESTCD, NVCAT, NVLOC, NVMETHOD, REFREG)   )

previous_headings: Programming Workflow > Initial PET Scan Analysis Dataset Set-up
title: Creating ADTPET and ADAPET
text: Now parameter-level variables created, can map Analysis Value variables. parameters, complex derivation required. Note AVALC mapped contains non-redundant information. established foundation global PET Scan Analysis Dataset (adpet), can now differentiate tau amyloid data.
code: adpet <- adpet %>%   mutate(     AVAL = NVSTRESN,     AVALC = if_else(       is.na(NVSTRESN) | as.character(NVSTRESN) != NVSTRESC,       NVSTRESC,       NA     )   )

previous_headings: Programming Workflow
title: Creating ADTPET and ADAPET
text: Tau PET scan data generally require derivations, conversion tau SUVR CenTauR available next release (0.2.0) package. Therefore, producing ADTPET, can now filter global PET Scan Analysis Dataset adpet retain tau tracer records.
code: adtpet <- adpet %>%   filter(AGCAT == "TAU TRACER")

previous_headings: Programming Workflow
title: Creating ADTPET and ADAPET
text: producing ADAPET, can now filter global PET Scan Analysis Dataset adpet retain amyloid tracer records.
code: adapet <- adpet %>%   filter(AGCAT == "AMYLOID TRACER")

previous_headings: Programming Workflow > ADAPET (Amyloid PET Scan Analysis Dataset)
title: Creating ADTPET and ADAPET
text: SUVR (Standardized Uptake Value Ratio) widely used semi-quantitative measure PET imaging estimates level radiopharmaceutical tracer uptake (amyloid) brain, relative reference region. useful, SUVR certain limitations (detail ) affect comparability across different tracers studies. address , Centiloid (CL) scale developed standardize amyloid PET measurements. scale anchored : 0 CL represents amyloid-negative individuals (usually younger, amyloid-negative individual). 100 CL corresponds amyloid burden observed patients Alzheimer’s disease. standardization enables consistent interpretation amyloid burden across imaging protocols, tracers, clinical studies. following steps, incorporate conversion amyloid SUVR Centiloid using function admiralneuro::compute_centiloid(). examples, divide process two main steps: 1. Define Source Variables first step define keep_vars, lists source variables retain copy newly derived records next step; variables remain dataset set NA derived rows. 2. Convert SUVR Centiloid second step uses admiral::derive_extreme_records() add new analysis records original SUVR values converted Centiloid using admiralneuro::compute_centiloid(). formula based tracer, pipeline reference region; therefore apply filtering conditions using argument filter_add, follows: Based (SUVRBFBB) tracer, (BERKELEY FBB SUVR PIPELINE) method, (Whole Cerebellum) reference region. Based (SUVRBFBP) tracer, (BERKELEY FBP SUVR PIPELINE) method, (Whole Cerebellum) reference region. Based (SUVRAFBB) tracer, (AVID FBB SUVR PIPELINE) method, reference region (Whole Cerebellum). Based (SUVRAFBP) tracer, (AVID FBP SUVR PIPELINE) method, reference region (Whole Cerebellum). new parameter values include AVAL, PARAMCD, PARAM, AVALU, assigned within set_values_to argument function. step, centiloid values derived independently row meets specified filtering condition, separate derivations performed four defined filtering conditions. parameters newly converted parameters look like:
code: keep_vars <- c(   get_admiral_option("subject_keys"),   adsl_vars,   exprs(ADT, ADY, VISIT) )  adapet <- adapet %>%   derive_extreme_records(     dataset = .,     dataset_add = .,     filter_add = (PARAMCD == "SUVRBFBB" & NVMETHOD == "BERKELEY FBB SUVR PIPELINE" & REFREG == "Whole Cerebellum"),     set_values_to = exprs(       AVAL = compute_centiloid(         tracer = "18F-Florbetaben",         pipeline = "BERKELEY FBB SUVR PIPELINE",         ref_region = "Whole Cerebellum",         suvr = AVAL       ),       PARAMCD = "CENTLD",       PARAM = "Centiloid value derived from SUVR pipeline",       AVALU = "CL"     ),     keep_source_vars = exprs(!!!keep_vars)   ) %>%   derive_extreme_records(     dataset = .,     dataset_add = .,     filter_add = (PARAMCD == "SUVRBFBP" & NVMETHOD == "BERKELEY FBP SUVR PIPELINE" & REFREG == "Whole Cerebellum"),     set_values_to = exprs(       AVAL = compute_centiloid(         tracer = "18F-Florbetapir",         pipeline = "BERKELEY FBP SUVR PIPELINE",         ref_region = "Whole Cerebellum",         suvr = AVAL       ),       PARAMCD = "CENTLD",       PARAM = "Centiloid value derived from SUVR pipeline",       AVALU = "CL"     ),     keep_source_vars = exprs(!!!keep_vars)   ) %>%   derive_extreme_records(     dataset = .,     dataset_add = .,     filter_add = (PARAMCD == "SUVRAFBB" & NVMETHOD == "AVID FBB SUVR PIPELINE" & REFREG == "Whole Cerebellum"),     set_values_to = exprs(       AVAL = compute_centiloid(         tracer = "18F-Florbetaben",         pipeline = "AVID FBB SUVR PIPELINE",         ref_region = "Whole Cerebellum",         suvr = AVAL       ),       PARAMCD = "CENTLD",       PARAM = "Centiloid value derived from SUVR pipeline",       AVALU = "CL"     ),     keep_source_vars = exprs(!!!keep_vars)   ) %>%   derive_extreme_records(     dataset = .,     dataset_add = .,     filter_add = (PARAMCD == "SUVRAFBP" & NVMETHOD == "AVID FBP SUVR PIPELINE" & REFREG == "Whole Cerebellum"),     set_values_to = exprs(       AVAL = compute_centiloid(         tracer = "18F-Florbetapir",         pipeline = "AVID FBP SUVR PIPELINE",         ref_region = "Whole Cerebellum",         suvr = AVAL       ),       PARAMCD = "CENTLD",       PARAM = "Centiloid value derived from SUVR pipeline",       AVALU = "CL"     ),     keep_source_vars = exprs(!!!keep_vars)   )

previous_headings: Programming Workflow > ADAPET (Amyloid PET Scan Analysis Dataset)
what: Derive Criterion Flag Variables for Amyloid Categories
title: Creating ADTPET and ADAPET
text: converted SUVR Centiloid, can now derive criterion flags amyloid categories. use Centiloid cutoff 24.1 define amyloid negative positive categories. 24.1 Centiloid cutoff comes autopsy-validated study amyloid PET SUVR values compared post-mortem brain amyloid plaque counts (Clark et al., 2012). SUVR threshold corresponding moderate--frequent neuritic plaques Consortium Establish Registry Alzheimer’s Disease (CERAD) criteria mapped Centiloid scale, yielding 24.1 CL pathology-based definition amyloid positivity (Navitsky et al., 2018). Centiloid >= 24.1 considered amyloid positive, Centiloid < 24.1 considered amyloid negative. , use admiral::derive_vars_crit_flag() function. Since want derive flags specifically Centiloid parameters, apply derivation records using admiral::restrict_derivation(). criterion flags look like:
code: adapet <- adapet %>%   restrict_derivation(     derivation = derive_vars_crit_flag,     args = params(       crit_nr = 1,       condition = if_else(PARAMCD == "CENTLD", AVAL < 24.1, NA),       description = "CENTILOID < 24.1",       values_yn = TRUE # To get "Y", "N", and NA for the flag     ),     filter = PARAMCD == "CENTLD"   )

title: Compute Centiloid Value — compute_centiloid
text: Computes Centiloid value based amyloid Positron Emission Tomography (PET) scan radioactive tracer, Standardized Uptake Value Ratio (SUVR) value, pipeline, reference region. Also allows custom formula parameters.

title: Compute Centiloid Value — compute_centiloid
code: compute_centiloid(   tracer,   pipeline,   ref_region,   suvr,   custom_slope = NULL,   custom_intercept = NULL )

title: Compute Centiloid Value — compute_centiloid
text: tracer Amyloid PET tracer character string expected. custom_slope custom_intercept specified, parameter ignored. See Details section accepted values combination pipeline ref_region. pipeline SUVR pipeline character string expected. custom_slope custom_intercept specified, parameter ignored. See Details section accepted values combination tracer ref_region. ref_region Reference region character string expected. custom_slope custom_intercept specified, parameter ignored. See Details section accepted values combination tracer ref_region. suvr SUVR value numeric value expected. custom_slope Optional slope parameter custom Centiloid calculation formula numeric value expected provided. custom_slope specified (along custom_intercept), overrides standard formula parameters tracer, pipeline, ref_region. Default NULL. custom_intercept Optional intercept parameter custom centiloid calculation formula numeric value expected provided. custom_intercept specified (along custom_slope), overrides standard formula parameters tracer, pipeline, ref_region. Default NULL.

title: Compute Centiloid Value — compute_centiloid
text: numeric Centiloid value.

title: Compute Centiloid Value — compute_centiloid
text: Centiloid scale standardized quantitative measure amyloid PET imaging allows comparison different tracers analysis methods. function converts SUVR values Centiloid scale based published conversion equations specific tracer, pipeline, reference region combinations. Centiloid calculated : $$Centiloid = slope \times SUVR + intercept$$ slope intercept formula parameters. custom_slope custom_intercept specified, function uses pre-defined slope intercept based user's selections tracer, pipeline, reference region. combinations tracer, pipeline reference region table supported. columns "slope" "intercept" show values slope intercept compute_centiloid() use calculate centiloid value case. equations used conversions based following references: ¹ Navitsky, et al. (2018). doi:10.1016/j.jalz.2018.06.1353  ² Sims, et al. (2024). doi:10.1001/jama.2023.13239  ³ Royse, et al. (2021). doi:10.1186/s13195-021-00836-1 Alternatively, user can override pre-selection specifying custom_slope custom_intercept instead. custom_slope custom_intercept specified, function ignores tracer, pipeline ref_region calculation purposes. However, function always requires specification tracer, pipeline, ref_region parameters, even using custom slope intercept values. design choice ensures users remain cognizant imaging context analysis methodology computing Centiloid values. additional Centiloid transformation formulas, see: Iaccarino, L. et al. (2025). doi:10.1016/j.nicl.2025.103765 matching combination tracer, pipeline, reference region specified custom_slope custom_intercept specified, function aborts error.

title: Compute Centiloid Value — compute_centiloid
code: # Using standard parameters compute_centiloid(   tracer = "18F-Florbetapir",   pipeline = "AVID FBP SUVR PIPELINE",   ref_region = "Whole Cerebellum",   suvr = 1.25 ) #> [1] 51.5775  # Using custom parameters compute_centiloid(   tracer = "MyTracer",   pipeline = "MyPipeline",   ref_region = "MyRegion",   suvr = 1.25,   custom_slope = 193,   custom_intercept = -187 ) #> [1] 54.25
